items.body_markdown:
I am developing a react native mobile app and using server side API for managing user related data (backend). Currently I am using AWS cognito for supporting user signup/signin and all the user details are seems to be saved in AWS user pool.

I want to store auth token and user details on my server side, so that I can use this details to fetch user related data. So, I want the following approach to implement

Request:

    Mobile App UI -> Server API (backend) -> AWS cognito

Response:

    AWS cognito -> Server API (backend) -> Mobile App UI

Is this possible? If not what would be the best approach.
items.title: AWS cognito: Store user auth token in backend server
items.body:
I am developing a react native mobile app and using server side API for managing user related data (backend). Currently I am using AWS cognito for supporting user signup/signin and all the user details are seems to be saved in AWS user pool.

I want to store auth token and user details on my server side, so that I can use this details to fetch user related data. So, I want the following approach to implement

Request:

Mobile App UI -> Server API (backend) -> AWS cognito

Response:

AWS cognito -> Server API (backend) -> Mobile App UI

Is this possible? If not what would be the best approach.

items.body_markdown:
I have a problem with this iBT6000GS Goodcom device. I made everything as described in instructions, but it prints an order only once (after I reboot it using remote configuration). And after I change content (order id) in defined "File path" file, it doesn't print new order, but from logs I see that device request to get new order comes.

Test line I'm trying to print (with php random order id generation):
"#16*1*".rand(11111,11919)."*2;Chiken;3.00;*0*0;29.10;4;Tom;Address of the Customer;15:47 03-08-10;113;7;cod:;008612345678;*Comment#\r\n"


Maybe any ideas why it prints only once, and why while polling it doesn't get second order and doesn't print it?
items.title: iBT6000GS prints new order only once after reboot
items.body:
I have a problem with this iBT6000GS Goodcom device. I made everything as described in instructions, but it prints an order only once (after I reboot it using remote configuration). And after I change content (order id) in defined "File path" file, it doesn't print new order, but from logs I see that device request to get new order comes.

Test line I'm trying to print (with php random order id generation): "#16*1*".rand(11111,11919)."*2;Chiken;3.00;*0*0;29.10;4;Tom;Address of the Customer;15:47 03-08-10;113;7;cod:;008612345678;*Comment#\r\n"

Maybe any ideas why it prints only once, and why while polling it doesn't get second order and doesn't print it?

items.body_markdown:
I try this code:

    import java.time.*; 
    ...
       LocalDateTime now = LocalDateTime.now();
       DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern(
                                        "dd-MMM-yyyy  HH:mm:ss.n");
       System.out.format("Now = %s %n", now.format(formatter));

in order to get an output with subsecond information
`Now = 12-Apr-2018  14:47:38.039578300`

Unfortunately, in the first 100 ms of every second, the leading zero of the subsecond information is omitted and I get a very misleading output `Now = 12-Apr-2018  14:47:38.39578300` , which can be easily misinterpreted as about 38.4 sec, or 396 ms after the full second, instead of the real 38.04 sec.

The only workarond I found, is a format of `ss.nnnnnnnnn` with exactly 9 `n`, to get my desired output.


**Edit**:

There is something nicer, which I missed in this area when posting this question.

I'm not really interested in Nanoseconds, but a fractional part of seconds (about ms resolution), is what I'm really looking for.

Then, this one is much more suitable

    DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("HH:mm:ss.SSS");

The capital S indicates the number of subsecond digits, including leading zeros of course.
items.title: Java8 LocalDateTime and NANO_OF_SECOND strange formatting
items.body:
I try this code:

import java.time.*; 
...
   LocalDateTime now = LocalDateTime.now();
   DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern(
                                    "dd-MMM-yyyy  HH:mm:ss.n");
   System.out.format("Now = %s %n", now.format(formatter));

in order to get an output with subsecond information Now = 12-Apr-2018 14:47:38.039578300

Unfortunately, in the first 100 ms of every second, the leading zero of the subsecond information is omitted and I get a very misleading output Now = 12-Apr-2018 14:47:38.39578300 , which can be easily misinterpreted as about 38.4 sec, or 396 ms after the full second, instead of the real 38.04 sec.

The only workarond I found, is a format of ss.nnnnnnnnn with exactly 9 n, to get my desired output.

Edit:

There is something nicer, which I missed in this area when posting this question.

I'm not really interested in Nanoseconds, but a fractional part of seconds (about ms resolution), is what I'm really looking for.

Then, this one is much more suitable

DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("HH:mm:ss.SSS");

The capital S indicates the number of subsecond digits, including leading zeros of course.

items.body_markdown:
I'm trying to create a wxPython TreeCtrl object from a tree object created using the anytree module. Most of the code works as expected but I can't wrap my head around the way the TreeCtrl is populated; most likely the recursion in `AddTreeNodes()` fails, producing multiple nodes, inconsistent (but deterministic) bevaviour etc.

The code below is a stripped-down version, has the essentials only and should work out-of-the box if anytree and wxPython are available - these both are available on PyPI.

Any help is very much appreciated!

    from anytree import NodeMixin, RenderTree
    import wx
    
    class MyClass(NodeMixin):  # Add Node feature
        def __init__(self, name, parent=None):
            super(MyClass, self).__init__()
            self.name = name
            self.parent = parent
    
    class TestFrame(wx.Frame):  # frame to house the wx.TreeCtrl
        def __init__(self, anytree_tree):
            wx.Frame.__init__(self, None, title="virtual tree with icons", size=(400, 500))
            self.tree = VWTreeCtrl(self, anytree_tree)
    
    class VWTreeCtrl(wx.TreeCtrl):
    
        def __init__(self, parent, anytree_tree):
            wx.TreeCtrl.__init__(self, parent)
            self.tree = anytree_tree  # the anytree structure to display
    
            # setting up the root
            root = self.AddRoot(self.tree.name)
            self.SetItemData(root, self.tree)
            self.SetItemHasChildren(root, True)
    
            # Bind some interesting events
            self.Bind(wx.EVT_TREE_ITEM_COLLAPSED, self.OnItemCollapsed, self)
            self.Bind(wx.EVT_TREE_ITEM_EXPANDING, self.OnItemExpanding, self)
    
        def AddTreeNodes(self, treenode):
            """Adds nodes starting at the node treenode"""
            node = self.GetItemData(treenode)  # the ANYTREE node
            for child in node.children:  # iterating the ANYTREE node children
                newtreenode = self.AppendItem(treenode, child.name)  # returns a treenode object
                self.SetItemData(newtreenode, child)  # setting the data
                self.SetItemHasChildren(treenode, True)  # enabling the clickable plus sign
                for ch in child.children:  # going through the children recursively
                    self.AddTreeNodes(newtreenode)
    
        def GetItemText(self, item):
            if item:
                return self.GetItemData(item).name
            else:
                return ""
    
        def OnItemExpanding(self, evt):
            # When the item is about to be expanded add the first level of child nodes
            treenode = evt.GetItem()
            self.AddTreeNodes(treenode)
    
        def OnItemCollapsed(self, evt):
            # And remove them when collapsed as we don't need them any longer
            self.DeleteChildren(evt.GetItem())
    
    def print_anytree(startnode):
    
        for pre, _, node in RenderTree(startnode):
            treestr = u"%s%s" % (pre, node.name)
            print(treestr.ljust(8))
    
    if __name__ == '__main__':
    
        my0 = MyClass('my0')
    
        my1 = MyClass(name='my1', parent=my0)
        my2 = MyClass(name='my2', parent=my0)
    
        my11 = MyClass(name='my11', parent=my1)
        my12 = MyClass(name='my12', parent=my1)
    
        my21 = MyClass(name='my21', parent=my2)
        my22 = MyClass(name='my22', parent=my2)
        my23 = MyClass(name='my23', parent=my2)
    
        my231 = MyClass(name='my231', parent=my23)
        my232 = MyClass(name='my232', parent=my23)
        my233 = MyClass(name='my233', parent=my23)
        my234 = MyClass(name='my234', parent=my23)
    
        print_anytree(my0)
    
        app = wx.App(redirect=True)
        frame = TestFrame(my0)
        frame.Show()
        app.MainLoop()
items.title: wxPython: creating a TreeCtrl from an AnyTree tree
items.body:
I'm trying to create a wxPython TreeCtrl object from a tree object created using the anytree module. Most of the code works as expected but I can't wrap my head around the way the TreeCtrl is populated; most likely the recursion in AddTreeNodes() fails, producing multiple nodes, inconsistent (but deterministic) bevaviour etc.

The code below is a stripped-down version, has the essentials only and should work out-of-the box if anytree and wxPython are available - these both are available on PyPI.

Any help is very much appreciated!

from anytree import NodeMixin, RenderTree
import wx

class MyClass(NodeMixin):  # Add Node feature
    def __init__(self, name, parent=None):
        super(MyClass, self).__init__()
        self.name = name
        self.parent = parent

class TestFrame(wx.Frame):  # frame to house the wx.TreeCtrl
    def __init__(self, anytree_tree):
        wx.Frame.__init__(self, None, title="virtual tree with icons", size=(400, 500))
        self.tree = VWTreeCtrl(self, anytree_tree)

class VWTreeCtrl(wx.TreeCtrl):

    def __init__(self, parent, anytree_tree):
        wx.TreeCtrl.__init__(self, parent)
        self.tree = anytree_tree  # the anytree structure to display

        # setting up the root
        root = self.AddRoot(self.tree.name)
        self.SetItemData(root, self.tree)
        self.SetItemHasChildren(root, True)

        # Bind some interesting events
        self.Bind(wx.EVT_TREE_ITEM_COLLAPSED, self.OnItemCollapsed, self)
        self.Bind(wx.EVT_TREE_ITEM_EXPANDING, self.OnItemExpanding, self)

    def AddTreeNodes(self, treenode):
        """Adds nodes starting at the node treenode"""
        node = self.GetItemData(treenode)  # the ANYTREE node
        for child in node.children:  # iterating the ANYTREE node children
            newtreenode = self.AppendItem(treenode, child.name)  # returns a treenode object
            self.SetItemData(newtreenode, child)  # setting the data
            self.SetItemHasChildren(treenode, True)  # enabling the clickable plus sign
            for ch in child.children:  # going through the children recursively
                self.AddTreeNodes(newtreenode)

    def GetItemText(self, item):
        if item:
            return self.GetItemData(item).name
        else:
            return ""

    def OnItemExpanding(self, evt):
        # When the item is about to be expanded add the first level of child nodes
        treenode = evt.GetItem()
        self.AddTreeNodes(treenode)

    def OnItemCollapsed(self, evt):
        # And remove them when collapsed as we don't need them any longer
        self.DeleteChildren(evt.GetItem())

def print_anytree(startnode):

    for pre, _, node in RenderTree(startnode):
        treestr = u"%s%s" % (pre, node.name)
        print(treestr.ljust(8))

if __name__ == '__main__':

    my0 = MyClass('my0')

    my1 = MyClass(name='my1', parent=my0)
    my2 = MyClass(name='my2', parent=my0)

    my11 = MyClass(name='my11', parent=my1)
    my12 = MyClass(name='my12', parent=my1)

    my21 = MyClass(name='my21', parent=my2)
    my22 = MyClass(name='my22', parent=my2)
    my23 = MyClass(name='my23', parent=my2)

    my231 = MyClass(name='my231', parent=my23)
    my232 = MyClass(name='my232', parent=my23)
    my233 = MyClass(name='my233', parent=my23)
    my234 = MyClass(name='my234', parent=my23)

    print_anytree(my0)

    app = wx.App(redirect=True)
    frame = TestFrame(my0)
    frame.Show()
    app.MainLoop()

items.title: RJSONIO fromJSON error
items.body:
I have a problem with the fromJSON function in RJSONIO package in R.

I have a json file to read with fromJSON

{"indy movies" :[
{
"name" : "Raiders of the Lost Ark",
"year" : 1981,
"actors" : {
    "Indiana Jones": "Harrison Ford", 
    "Dr. René Belloq": "Paul Freeman" 
    },
"producers": ["Frank Marshall", "George Lucas", "Howard Kazanjian"],
"budget" : 18000000,
"academy_award_ve": true
},
{
"name" : "Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom",
"year" : 1984,
"actors" : {
    "Indiana Jones": "Harrison Ford", 
    "Mola Ram": "Amish Puri"
    },
"producers": ["Robert Watts"],
"budget" : 28170000,
"academy_award_ve": true
},
{
"name" : "Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade",
"year" : 1989,
"actors" : {
    "Indiana Jones": "Harrison Ford", 
    "Walter Donovan": "Julian Glover"
    },
"producers": ["Robert Watts", "George Lucas"],
"budget" : 48000000,
"academy_award_ve": false
}]}

The file name is "indy.json"

Here is a reproducible example:

indy <- fromJSON(content = "indy.json")

However,i get the result:

> indy <- fromJSON(content = "indy.json")
Error in nchar(content) : invalid multibyte string, element 1

Here is my relevant sessionInfo()

R version 3.3.3 (2017-03-06)
Platform: x86_64-apple-darwin13.4.0 (64-bit)
Running under: macOS Sierra 10.12.4

Can anyone please suggest why this is happening?

items.title: Can't make ViewPager's next and previous pages visible
items.body:
Edit: don't flag this question with Android ViewPager - Show preview of page on left and right duplicate, the problem is different

In my application I want to make previous and next pages of my viewpager visible.

I set clip to padding false first:

 viewPager.setClipToPadding(false);

Then I calculate the reasonable left and right paddings:

float density = getResources().getDisplayMetrics().density;
        int partialWidth = (int) (16 * density); // 16dp
        int pageMargin = (int) (8 * density); // 8dp

        int viewPagerPadding = partialWidth + pageMargin;

I set the paddings and page margin:

viewPager.setPageMargin(pageMargin);
        viewPager.setPadding(viewPagerPadding, 0, viewPagerPadding, 0);

I set the adapter and off screen limit:

viewPager.setAdapter(cardPagerAdapter);
        viewPager.setOffscreenPageLimit(cardPagerAdapter.getCount());

here is my fancy transition animation:

viewPager.setPageTransformer(false, (page, position) -> {
            final float normalizedPosition = Math.abs(Math.abs(position) - 1);
            page.setScaleX(normalizedPosition / 2 + 0.5f);
            page.setScaleY(normalizedPosition / 2 + 0.5f);


        });

This is my custom viewpager:

<com.magis.icbc.util.view.WrapContentHeightViewPager
            android:id="@+id/viewPager"
            android:layout_width="match_parent"
            android:layout_height="wrap_content"
            android:layout_gravity="top"
            android:background="@color/primary_darker"
            android:clipToPadding="false"
            android:overScrollMode="never"
            android:paddingBottom="20dp"
            android:paddingTop="20dp" />

I made it custom so it can wrap content height, it's a workaround for this "bug" http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8394681/android-i-am-unable-to-have-viewpager-wrap-content/20784791#20784791

However nothing has changed, I still cant see the previous and next pages like this:

items.title: elasticksearch nested query
items.body:
I have a index with some nested informations and right now struggle with how make to make a query.

The index below represents a car piece and this piece belongs to 2 cars. 

  {
    "_index": "items_production_20180411115923024",
    "_type": "item",
    "_id": "1232",
    "_score": 21.715849,
    "_source": {
      "description": "CUBO RODA TRASEIRA VW:GOL, VOYAGE G5/G6 09> C/ABS",
      "observation": null,
      "brand_id": "1 ",
      "product_line_id": "13",
      "line_id": "1",
      "line": "Rolamentos",
      "segment_id": "21",
      "segment": "cubo de roda",
      "application_features": [
        "4 furos"
      ],
      "original_codes": [
        " 5u0 501 611 "
      ],
      "original_brands": [
        "volkswagen"
      ],
      "vehicles": [
        {
          "id": "285",
          "brand": "volkswagen",
          "name": "golf",
          "years": [
            "2009",
            "2010",
            "2011",
            "2012",
            "2013",
            "2014",
            "2015",
            "2016",
            "2017",
            "2018"
          ]
        },
        {
          "id": "345",
          "brand": "volkswagen",
          "name": "jetta",
          "years": [
            "2015",
            "2016",
            "2017",
            "2018"
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  }

I have to make the query match to one single result when search for the model and year of a car. Ie:

GET items_production_20180411115923024/_search
   {
     "query":{
    "bool":{
      "must":{
        "multi_match":{
          "query":"golf 2010",
          "type":"cross_fields",
          "operator":"and",
          "fields":[
            "vehicles.name^8",
            "vehicles.years^8"
          ]
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "size":10,"from":0
}

I have to return all docs wich are pieces of a golf year 2010. But my response is none?

What I'm doing wrong? How can I make this query?

items.title: select only visible options from multiselect
items.body:
I am Trying to get only visible elements from multiselect.

Jquery:

var button = $("button")
button.on("click", function(){
  var selectedOpts = $('#test option').prop( "disabled", false );
  console.log(selectedOpts);
})

$('#test option') returns all the elements

expected output: it should return only visible element

HTML:

<button>select</button>
<select multiple="multiple" id="test" class="form-control">
    <option value="15" style="display: none;">one</option>
    <option value="32" style="display: none;">two</option>
    <option value="68" style="display: none;">three</option>
    <option value="1" style="">four</option>                                                                                          
</select>

Demo code : https://jsfiddle.net/xpvt214o/109483/

items.body_markdown:
I had a Windows (Windows 10) local userprofile with an umlaut (ä) in it. With this I got problems while using vagrant in the Git Bash console. After some research I changed the username of my local profile (replaced the ä with ae). I also changed the name of the users folder and reinstalled vagrant after this. Everything works fine now except the fact, that the username which is shown in Git Bash is the same as before (with ä in it). But the path is correct (with ae).

I tried to change the username with `git config --global user.name` but this had no effect on the name displayed. I also reinstalled Git.

This is annoying (even tho it has no effect on anything). Why is that and how can I change it? Is there a way to reset it completely (besides a reinstallation)?

Because I'm not sure if I use the correct terms I mean this (the bold word) with username:

**MyNameWithÄ**@COMPUTERNAME MINGW64 ~

And I should also mention that I use Git only locally.

Kind regards

items.title: VS2015, WCF service wouldn't start?
items.body:
I'm trying to deploy a cfw hosted on sharepoint with visual studio.

So I have two solutions, one with my sharepoint empty project which containts my svc file in a folder ISAPI ==> PSI My svc file: Test.PS2016.PSIExtension:

<%@ServiceHost language="c#" Service="Test.PS2016.PSIExtension.Service, Test.PS2016.PSIExtension, Version=2.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=a753603f9baa3681"%>

After that I have another solution: Test.PS2016.PSIExtension which containts my Iservice, Service and my web.config So here my webconfig:

<configuration>
  <system.serviceModel>
    <bindings>
      <basicHttpBinding>
        <binding name="extensionBasicHttpConf"
                 closeTimeout="00:01:00"
                 openTimeout="00:01:00"
                 receiveTimeout="00:10:00"
                 sendTimeout="00:01:00"
                 allowCookies="true"
                 maxBufferSize="4194304"
                 maxReceivedMessageSize="500000000"
                 messageEncoding="Text"
                 transferMode="StreamedResponse">
          <security mode="TransportCredentialOnly">
            <transport clientCredentialType="Ntlm" proxyCredentialType="Ntlm" realm="" />
          </security>
        </binding>
        <binding name="mexHttpBinding">
          <security mode="TransportCredentialOnly">
            <transport clientCredentialType="Ntlm" proxyCredentialType="Ntlm" realm="" />
          </security>
        </binding>
      </basicHttpBinding>
    </bindings>
    <behaviors>
      <serviceBehaviors>
        <behavior name="PSIExtensionServiceBehavior">
          <serviceDebug includeExceptionDetailInFaults="false" />
          <serviceMetadata httpGetEnabled="true" httpsGetEnabled="true" />
        </behavior>
      </serviceBehaviors>
    </behaviors>
    <services>
      <service name="Test.PS2016.PSIExtension.Service"
             behaviorConfiguration="PSIExtensionServiceBehavior">
        <endpoint address=""
                  binding="basicHttpBinding"
                  bindingConfiguration="extensionBasicHttpConf"
                  contract="Test.PS2016.PSIExtension.IService" />
        <endpoint address="mex"
                  binding="basicHttpBinding"
                  bindingConfiguration="mexHttpBinding"
                  name="mex"
                  contract="IMetadataExchange" />
      </service>
    </services>
  </system.serviceModel>
</configuration>

And when I deploy my sharepoint solution, I have the following message: Skipping Deployment step because a post-deployment command is not specificied

And when I tried to reach my _vti_bin, I have the following error message which appears:

The type 'Test.PS2016.PSIExtension.Service, Test.PS2016.PSIExtension', provided as the Service attribute value in the ServiceHost directive, or provided in the configuration element system.serviceModel/serviceHostingEnvironment/serviceActivations could not be found. Technical Details

Troubleshoot issues with Microsoft SharePoint Foundation.

Correlation ID: 57b55c9e-e17a-10ac-87ad-245849ea40f5

Date and Time: 4/12/2018 11:21:10 AM

I've already checked my namsepace service and they are good and if I navigate to webpage before my service (http://SharepointSite/_vti_bin/PSI/), I see the service in my list and when I click on it, the error message comes backs Any idea of what I miss?

Thanks for your help

Several time series were measured for the same objects.  Unfortunately, the x and y coordinates are all put together into two comma-separated strings.  To make things more complicated, the number of time series and the x coordinates varied between time series.

So, for example, I have a data frame that looks something like:

    Object   Overall_Prop   X                                              Y
    obj1         4.5        "0, 1, 3, 6, 1, 3, 5, 7, 0, 1, 3, 5, 7"   "3, 9, 10, 11, 8, 10, 12, 14, 3.1, 8.5, 9, 12.5, 14.5"
    obj2         9.9        "1, 3, 6, 9"                               "7, 9, 10, 14.2"

    Object    Overall_Prop  Curve  X  Y

    obj1            4.5        1   1  9
    obj1            4.5        1   3  10

May you please help me?

But when I execute that stored procedure in Azure logic apps my result of the same xml object gets split into multiple json objects instead of one json object with the full xml string inside.

In SQL Server Management Studio, I have `FOR XML RAW, Root('<RootName>')` after the SQL select statement.

Why is this, and how do I solve this problem?

items.title: The instance of entity type 'Product' cannot be tracked because another instance with the same key value is already being tracked
items.body:
I made a test with code below to update the Product:

var existing = await _productRepository.FirstOrDefaultAsync(c => c.Id == input.Id);
if (existing == null)
    throw new UserFriendlyException(L("ProductNotExist"));
var updatedEntity = ObjectMapper.Map<Product>(input);
var entity = await _productRepository.UpdateAsync(updatedEntity);

But it throws an exception:

Mvc.ExceptionHandling.AbpExceptionFilter - The instance of entity type 'Product' cannot be tracked because another instance with the same key value for {'Id'} is already being tracked. When attaching existing entities, ensure that only one entity instance with a given key value is attached.

This is caused by querying existing. Is there any solution for this?

items.title: How to get only one value from hashmap which contains key String, and list<Object>
items.body:
How to get only one value from hashmap which contains key String, and list

hashmap:

HashMap<String, ArrayList<Person>> person = new HashMap<String, ArrayList<Person>>();

constructor Person:

Person(int phone, String mail){
    this.phone = phone;
    this.mail = mail;
}

method to get object:

protected void findObject(String lname){
    if (person.containsKey(lname)) {
            System.out.println(lname + " phone: " + person.get(lname));
    }
}

but i need two methods:

protected void findPhone(String lname){
//should get only phone from Person;
}

protected void findMail(String mail){
//should get only mail from Person;
}

work like this:

protected List<Integer> findPhone(String lname) {
    List<Integer> listPhone = null;
    if (person.containsKey(lname)) {
        listPhone = person.get(lname).stream()
        .map(Person::getPhone)
        .collect(Collectors.toList());

    }
    return listPhone;
}

protected List<String> findMail(String lname) {
    List<String> listMail = null;
    if (person.containsKey(lname)) {
        listMail = person.get(lname).stream()
        .map(Person::getPhone)
        .collect(Collectors.toList());

    }
    return listmail;
}

items.title: Extending models from a base model in CakePHP3 which share the same table
items.body:
I have a users table which is populated by CakeDC/Users, and I need to have support for 3 types of users (this won't change for the upcoming future): admins, fighters and referees. Since I want to keep users pure incase there are CakeDC field updates I decided to create a "profiles" table named my_users which belongsTo users and the 3 extending tables will use users.role and users.is_superuser to determine if the user is an admin, fighter or referee.

So to summarize, my Table/plugin setup is:

  • vendor/users/src/Model/Table/UsersTable which is the core CakeDC/users table.

  • plugins/MyUsers/src/Model/Table/MyUsersTable which defines base validation rules shared by admins, referees and fighters.

  • plugins/Fighters/src/Model/Table/FightersTable which extends MyUsersTable and I can define specific validation rules for each.

  • plugins/Referees/src/Model/Table/FightersTable and plugins/Admins/src/Model/Table/AdminsTable, same as the above

To differentiate between the different users, I've established a beforeFind on MyUsersTable which innerJoins to users based on the respective table's ROLE class constant.

MyUsersTable.php:

class MyUsersTable extends Table
{   
    public function initialize(array $config)
    {
        parent::initialize($config);

        $this->setTable('my_users');

        $this->setPrimaryKey('user_id');

        $this->belongsTo('Users', [
            'className' => 'Users.Users',
            'foreignKey' => 'user_id',
        ]);
    }

    /**
     * @param Cake\Event\Event $event
     * @param Cake\ORM\Query $query
     * @param ArrayObject $options
     */
    public function beforeFind(Event $event, Query $query, \ArrayObject $options)
{
        $and = [];

        // set superuser
        if (defined(static::class.'::IS_ADMIN') && static::IS_ADMIN) {
            $and['is_superuser'] = 1;
        }

        // set the role
        if (defined(static::class.'::ROLE') && mb_strlen(static::ROLE) > 0) {
            $and['role'] = static::ROLE;
        }

        // set user conditions
        $query->innerJoinWith('Users', function($query) use($and) {
            return $query->andWhere($and);
        });
    }

    /**
     * @param \Cake\ORM\Query $query
     * @param array $options
     */
    public function findByRegistrationCode(Query $query, array $options): Query
    {
        $query->where([
            $this->aliasField('registration_no') => $options['registration_no']
        ]);

        return $query;
    }
}

And FightersTable.php:

use MyUsers\Model\Table\MyUsers;

class FightersTable extends MyUsersTable
{       
    const ROLE = 'fighter';

    public function initialize(array $config)
    {   
        parent::initialize($config);

        $this->setEntityClass('Fighters\Model\Entity\Fighter');
    }       

    /**
     * @param Validator $validator
     * @return Validator $validator
     */
    public function validationDefault(Validator $validator): Validator
    {
        $validator = parent::validationDefault($validator);

        $validator->allowEmpty('field');
    }
}

With FightersTable and Referees/Admins, you can see that I establish a role class constant which is used in MyUsers::beforeFind. I also define separate entity models in initialize.

So far the "gotchas" have been that:

  1. I need to use $this->aliasField in MyUsers so this can work reliably without throwing an ambiguous column because Cake tries to map/distinguish due to FightersTable extending MyUsers.
  2. If I need to do an entity pull within MyUsersTable and I want to reference just the MyUsersTable itself, I need to call TableRegistry::get('MyUsers.MyUsers') because $this would make this dynamically work with Drivers and apply the beforeFind condition.

My question/concerns given this setup:

  1. Is there a more "cake" way of accomplishing this without creating separate tables for Referees/Fighters/Admins? Originally I had just MyUsers and finders for the 3 user types, but the class became a little messy and in my opinion, this approach is cleaner.
  2. Can I avoid gotcha #1 or gotcha #2 at all?
  3. Any restrictions or can there be any optimizations with this setup? I don't foresee more than 400 users in the next 2 years so hoping the innerJoinWith Users on the beforeFind isn't too bad because the role exists in users and moving it would cause redundancy.

items.title: Spring MVC remote Thymeleaf UrlTemplateResolver fragment issues
items.body:
I have a test running where I have setup two Spring Boot applications one with a header fragment and the other with an index page.

Fragment application = localhost:8080

<header th:fragment="application-header" id="application-header">
CONTENT 
</header>

Index application = localhost:7950

<header th:include="http://localhost:8080/application-header.tpl.html ::
   [//header[@id='application-header']]">
</header>

The header displays properly within the calling application.

I have a few problems with the way things are acting right now.

1: If I update the Fragment application the update will not propagate to the Index application unless I restart the application.

2: If the Fragment application is unavailable on the first index load the Index application will fail with a 500 error.

3: I had to use [//header[@id='application-header']] the fragment name did not work within the Index application. Not really a problem but I thought from reading that the fragment name would have worked

@Bean
public UrlTemplateResolver urlTemplateResolver(){
    UrlTemplateResolver urlTemplateResolver = new UrlTemplateResolver();
    urlTemplateResolver.setOrder(20);
    return urlTemplateResolver;
}
